alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 11:11AM CST until March 03 at 12:45PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FOR NORTHWESTERN TUSCALOOSA COUNTY... At 1110 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oakman to near Lake Lurleen State Park, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Coker, Samantha, McFarland Mall, Lake Lurleen State Park, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Bryant Denny Stadium, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, University Mall, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Binion Creek Landing, Bull City, Whitson, Lake Tuscaloosa, Cottondale, Windham Springs and Flatwoods. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for central and west central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for central and west central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
